DOC.brief_summary: The trial consisted of a 2 week Run-In period, 12 week double-blind Treatment period and 2 week Safety Follow-Up period. Subjects were randomized to one of 4 treatment arms receiving either fesoterodine (SPM 907) 4mg, fesoterodine 8mg, active control (tolterodine SR 4mg) or placebo during the Double-Blind Treatment Period. Two primary efficacy variables will be assessed for submission in the United States: change in the average number of micturitions (frequency) per 24 hours and the change in the average number of urge incontinence episodes per 24 hours. For the submissions in the European Union, the first primary variable will be the change in the average number of micturitions (frequency) per 24 hours and the co-primary variable is the treatment response, based on a treatment benefit scale. All continuous variables will be measured as changes from baseline to value after 12 weeks of treatment. The most important safety variables included the assessment of adverse events, laboratory parameters, changes in ECG, physical exams and measurement of residual urine.
DOC.brief_title: A Multicenter Trial to Investigate Fesoterodine Sustained Release in Overactive Bladder Syndrome
DOC.criteria: Overactive Bladder Syndrome less than 8 micturitions in 24 hours
